intro: Tetrasperma juncea, commonly known as the slender tetrasperma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, a feature known as monoecious. Tetrasperma juncea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
